criticism: The function returns the right coordinate of a byte input. The byte input is masked with byte(15) to get the right 4 bits. If the input is greater than 15, the result will be an overflow. This can lead to incorrect results and potential exploitation.

The function returns the left coordinate of a byte input. The byte input is right-shifted by 4 bits to get the left 4 bits. If the input is greater than 15, the result will be an overflow. This can lead to incorrect results and potential exploitation.

The function resets the game by updating the game number, winner, and other relevant variables. It calculates the winning amount by multiplying the current game balance by 9/10. If the current game balance is greater than the calculated winning amount, the result will be an overflow. This can lead to incorrect results and potential exploitation.
